title: [standard] CAD programs fonts
content:
Hi, I need to pick your brains. When you have time, some questions related to fonts for producing technical drawings with CAD programs according to the ISO standards.  
Thank you in advance.
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content: Not sure what you're looking for, but Autocad ships with ISOCPEUR (proportional) and ISOCTEUR (fixed pitch). Standards include DIN-ISO 3098 (Part 5 for Latin lettering) and DIN-ISO 10646. Luc Devroye has a page on CAD fonts at [http://cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/autocad.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144908/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/autocad.html "http://cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/autocad.html").
Thanks very much for the message, Gus.
